Articles.Content:
Finally got this balanced enough to require minimal trimming and is capable of fairly stable flight, as well as extreme maneuvering.

Be gentle, it\'s biased to turning fast, it\'s best to snap at 22.5 degree angles and lock it with the SAS if you need to turn quickly while maintaining control. To do things similar to the Herbst and Kulbit maneuvers, you need to build up a nice bit of level speed, turn off SAS, snap the nose vertical, cut your thrust to 0 while pushing your stick forward as soon as you\'re aiming straight up (counter-intuitive, I know, trust me on it though), this will snap force you into a Herbst-esque turn, like so:

Turn SAS on and crank throttle to 100% to complete this, or, pull your stick back again and you\'ll complete a very tight Kulbit-ish loop. Which again, you want to turn on SAS and throw your throttle to max to recover.
